Node.definition: = action by which humans speak to a deity, often by raising their hands, ► requesting help or expressing their thankfulness
= a class of people who are suffering, often because of poverty but also because of an oppressive external situation; ≈ associated with humility
= state in which humans are totally without inner strength; ◄ caused by physical or non physical suffering
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
literally: to pour our (one's) complaint; hence: = action by which humans give full vent to their complaints
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= action by which humans speak to a deity, often by raising their hands, ► requesting help or expressing their thankfulness
= action by which humans raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else

literally: to hide (one's) face (from someone); hence: = action by which a deity does not engage with people, and does not intervene neither in their favor nor to punish, ◄ as if he were enable to see them

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= a state in which humans experience extreme anxiety, ◄ as a result of difficult circumstances, as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape
literally: to bend (one's) ear; hence: = action by which humans or deities make a conscious effort to listen to what (other) humans say
= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another
= action by which humans or deities act without delay
= action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions
literally: (one's) days are finished; hence: = process by which people go through life for a particular amount of time
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
literally: bones; hence: = the physical body of a human being

m.definition: = iron framework; ◄ part of an altar or fire place; ► location where objects are burned; ≈ associated with fire

Node.definition: = to be affected by a burning sensation
= any of various plants, herbs, grasses, seed bearing vegetation that can be consumed by human and/or animal

Node.gloss: to dry up > to become weak
Node.definition: = process by which someone loses vital energy ◄ due to anxiety or some trouble
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general
= act by which humans make a deep inarticulate sound ◄ caused by pain, grief, or severe suffering
= state in which an object is positioned around or against another object in such a way that the two cannot be separated easily
= any of the pieces of hard, whitish material that together consitute the skeleton of humans and animals; ≈ associated with strength
= the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat

Node.gloss: to be like|to be comparable to|to resemble
Node.definition: = process by which the similarity or dissimilarity between two entities is measured
exact meaning unsure: = relatively small black bird; ► unclean; ≈ associated with loneliness, devastation, destruction, and possibly death
= area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals

exact meaning unknown; probably: = a small type of owl, of about 25 centimeters (10 inches) in length, with a short tail and without ear tufts, which feeds at night mainly on insects and nestlings; it nests in holes in banks or termite hills; ◄ Athene noctua; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten
= a place where no one can live, whether as a result of destruction or not
= generic term for a small bird; ► usually clean and can therefore be eaten

Node.gloss: to be alone|to be isolated|to be a straggler
Node.definition: = state of being apart from others belonging to the same group
= the structure forming the upper covering of a building, usually built as a terrace, to which one goes up by stairs
literally: all the day; hence: = process by which an event or pattern of events takes place for an extended time, without interruption

Node.gloss: to reproach|to taunt|to insult|to defy|to blaspheme
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans make an effort to arouse an emotion of shame in (other) humans or deities; ◄ by their words or actions
= person who has a conflict with someone else and acts accordingly
= causative action by which deities or humans cause (other) humans to either become fools or look like fools
literally: to swear (by someone); hence: = action by which humans utter a curse calling on someone's name with the purpose of mocking that person

= powdery residue left after the burning of a substance; normally deposited outside of a village or city; ► used by mourners to put on their heads or roll themselves into; ≈ associated with things that are fine and powdery and easily scattered by the wind, with low status, and possibly with mortality as well
= a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= action by which someone express his/her grief or sorrow by shedding tears, crying loud and making appropriate gestures, ◄ because of some personal or national calamity, or for a dead person
= action by which humans mix different ingredients into a single substance
= action by which humans or deities express their intense anger; ◄ caused by someone else's behavior, ► almost invariably resulting in punishment for the party that is responsible
= process by which humans or deities respond with anger to a situation in which (other) humans have disobeyed an order or broken a law

Node.gloss: to take up|to lift up|to carry
Node.definition: literally: to lift up; hence: = action by which humans take hold of objects with their hands, with the intention of holding them or bringing them to another location
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
literally: to stretch itself; hence: = process in which an object becomes larger
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= any of various plants, herbs, grasses, seed bearing vegetation that can be consumed by human and/or animal

Node.gloss: to dry up > to become weak
Node.definition: = process by which someone loses vital energy ◄ due to anxiety or some trouble
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future
= action by which humans or deities assume a position of leadership, ◄ as if sitting on an actual throne
literally: remembrance; hence: = appellation through which one can be remembered
= all of the people born and living at about the same time
= all of the people born and living at about the same time
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse

Node.gloss: to be merciful|to have mercy (on someone)|to have compassion (on someone)
Node.definition: = state in which humans or deities feel compassion for other, ◄ caused by affection for that person and/or the lack of well being of that person; ► this feeling is usually translated into action: a person who feels compassion may forgive an offence, refrain from aggression and/or punishment, or revoke punishment
= mountain; ► that part of Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם) on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of David (דָּוִד) YHWH's dwelling place
= a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time

Node.gloss: to be kindly disposed|to be generous|to be merciful|to be gracious|to pity
Node.definition: = state in which humans or deities are favorably disposed to (other) humans, and act accordingly
= a fixed point in time for a particular event

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= block of stone, whether fully square or not;◄ found in nature or hewn from a quarry; ► used for building houses, walls, and other constructions

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= the loose natural substance of the earth's surface

Node.gloss: to be kindly disposed|to be generous|to be merciful|to be gracious|to pity
Node.definition: = state in which humans or deities are favorably disposed to (other) humans, and act accordingly

Node.gloss: to be afraid|to fear|to be in awe of|to revere
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience fear

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
literally: name; hence: = the core of one's identity, which reflect the essence of one's being
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority
= action by which humans perform construction activities, either in order to erect a new building or to rebuild or repair an existing one
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= mountain; ► that part of Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם) on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of David (דָּוִד) YHWH's dwelling place

Node.gloss: to be seen|to become visible|to appear
Node.definition: = process by which humans, deities, or objects become perceptible, primarily though not necessarily exclusively to the eye
= position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority
= action by which humans speak to a deity, often by raising their hands, ► requesting help or expressing their thankfulness
= person who is extremely poor and lacking the means to provide for himself

Node.gloss: to despise|to disdain|to scorn|to consider (something) beneath (oneself)
Node.definition: = state in which someone considers someone or something else unworthy of attention or respect, and shows that by his/her actions

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= action by which humans speak to a deity, often by raising their hands, ► requesting help or expressing their thankfulness
= action by which humans or deities mark letters, words or other symbols on a surface, such as clay, stone, skin, or papyrus, usually with a pointed stylus or reed
= all of the people born and living at about the same time
= pertaining to being the latest in a chronological range of events, which may be situated in either past, present, or future
= causative action by which a deity brings to existence something that did not exist before
= action by which humans or divine beings express their appreciation, admiration, respect, and/or gratitude to (other) humans or deities about who they are and what they do
= short form of יהוה (יהוה) only found in poetic texts
= state in which by which humans or objects have become part of the realm of God and his service ► and therefore no longer accessible to humans unless they have gone through special rituals
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
a more or less fixed phrase: the heavens and the earth, equivalent to a single lexical item: the totality of God's creation

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= act by which humans make a deep inarticulate sound ◄ caused by pain, grief, or severe suffering
= person who is locked up in a prison or other location where one does not have the freedom to act and go at will
= causative action by which humans and deities release a prisoner
= state of being associated with a certain attribute, attitude, or behavior, ◄ referred to as a child of that attribute, attitude, or behavior

Node.gloss: to tell|to recount|to proclaim: to declare
Node.definition: = action by which humans communicate verbally to others about an event or situation, with focus on the contents rather than on the speech act
= mountain; ► that part of Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם) on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of David (דָּוִד) YHWH's dwelling place
literally: name; hence: = the information that is generally known about a person or deity, which may either be good or bad and has a direct impact on the way this person or deity is regarded
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state in which humans or deities are considered worthy of praise
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom

Node.gloss: to come together|to gather|to assemble|to rally|to (re)unite
Node.definition: = action by which humans or animals come together as a group for a common purpose
= state in which humans or objects are jointly involved in an event

= action by which humans, either as individuals or as groups, assume a position of subservience towards a deity, perform the required rituals, and live in accordance with the requirements of that deity

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
literally: to bow down; hence: = causative action in which a humans or deities cause (other) humans to suffer hardship and trouble, ► resulting in a state of inability to help oneself
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= causative action by which humans or divine beings cause other humans or divine beings to move up in a supernatural way
= a point of time in the middle of a larger period of time
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= all of the people born and living at about the same time
= all of the people born and living at about the same time

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
literally: to found; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities bring something into existence
literally: hand, used metonymically to denote the owner of the hand; hence: = the person who is the originator of a particular event
a more or less fixed phrase: the heavens and the earth, equivalent to a single lexical item: the totality of God's creation

Node.gloss: to vanish|to disappear|to be lost|to perish|to be broken|to be destroyed|to be ruined
Node.definition: = process by which humans or objects disappear or are removed from existence;◄ either by (a usually unnatural) death, aggression, hardship, disaster, natural processes, acts of destruction, or direct divine intervention
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse
= generic designation for any article of clothing
= to gradually disappear from existence ◄ like a cloth that slowly wears out and finally falls apart
= generic designation for any article of clothing
= to replace one object by another
= to stop existing
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God
= a person’s child or children, or the young of an animal
literally: to be established; hence: = process by which humans find security and stability
